IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK'S MISSION IS TO LEAD THE MOVEMENT AND NURTURE THE BELIEF THAT TOGETHER WE CAN IMPROVE THE LIVES OF MARYLANDERS BY ENDING HUNGER.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK IS A NONPROFIT HUNGER-RELIEF ORGANIZATION, LEADING THE MOVEMENT TO END HUNGER THROUGHOUT MARYLAND. FOR 40 YEARS, THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK HAS PARTNERED WITH COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE TO DISTRIBUTE FOOD TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN NEED. CONTINUED FROM PAGE 2, PART III, LINE 1:THROUGH CAREFULLY CRAFTED PROGRAMS, THE FOOD BANK AIMS TO MEET THE IMMEDIATE NEEDS OF MARYLANDERS WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY WORKING TO FIND LONG TERM WAYS TO REDUCE HUNGER STATEWIDE. CURRENTLY DISTRIBUTING MORE THAN 102,000 MEALS A DAY (MORE THAN 37 MILLION MEALS ANNUALLY), THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK WILL CONTINUE TO EXPAND ITS EFFORTS UNTIL HUNGER ENDS.
IRS990.Desc: ACCORDING TO THE LATEST FEEDING AMERICA MAP THE MEAL GAP REPORT, 665,420 MARYLANDERS ARE CURRENTLY FOOD INSECURE, UNCERTAIN OF WHERE THEIR NEXT MEAL WILL COME FROM. COLLECTIVELY, THEY MISS 119 MILLION MEALS EACH YEAR. THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK EXISTS TO BRIDGE THIS MEAL GAP, GATHERING AND DISTRIBUTING MASSIVE QUANTITIES OF FOOD TO FAMILIES IN NEED EACH YEAR, WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY ENGAGING OTHER STAKEHOLDERS FROM THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS IN THE FIGHT TO END HUNGER. (SEE SCHEDULE O FOR CONTINUATION)THANKS TO A STRONG NETWORK OF DISTRIBUTION PARTNERS MADE UP OF, PANTRIES, SHELTERS AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK IS ABLE TO DEVELOP THOUGHTFUL, INNOVATIVE STRATEGIES, COMMUNITY-BY-COMMUNITY, UNTIL HUNGER ENDS. AS THE STATE'S LARGEST NONPROFIT HUNGER-RELIEF ORGANIZATION, THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK HAS BEEN LEADING THE MOVEMENT TO END HUNGER IN MARYLAND FOR 40 YEARS. EVERY DAY, MARYLAND FOOD BANK TRUCKS ARE ON THE ROAD, DISTRIBUTING FOOD TO A NETWORK OF APPROXIMATELY 1,150 DISTRIBUTION POINTS MADE UP OF PANTRIES, SHELTERS, SCHOOLS AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS ACROSS ITS 22-JURISDICTION SERVICE AREA. BEYOND PROVIDING MILLIONS OF POUNDS OF FOOD EACH YEAR, THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK OFFERS THESE LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS WITH TRAININGS, GRANTS, AND ACCESS TO MUCH-NEEDED EQUIPMENT LIKE REFRIGERATORS, CHEST FREEZERS AND SHELVING. THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK IS CONSTANTLY EVALUATING ITS NETWORK, RECRUITING MORE PARTNERS IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, AND FACILITATING COLLABORATION AND RESOURCE SHARING BETWEEN EXISTING PARTNERS TO EXPAND SERVICES AND BETTER MEET THE NEED.THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK ALSO OVERSEES SEVERAL INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS THAT FURTHER BRIDGE SERVICE GAPS SUPPLYING HEALTHY, NUTRITIOUS FOODS TO POPULATIONS AND GEOGRAPHIC AREAS THAT REMAIN UNDERSERVED. AMONG THESE PROGRAMS ARE:THE FARM TO FOOD BANK PROGRAM, WHICH ADDRESSES CHALLENGES IN SUPPLYING NUTRITIOUS, FRESH FOOD BY SECURING DONATIONS DIRECT FROM LOCAL FARMS. FARMS CAN DONATE DIRECTLY; ALLOW THE FOOD BANK TO CONDUCT SECOND AND THIRD GLEANINGS IN FIELDS; OR CONTRACT TO GROW THE TYPES AND QUANTITIES OF FOOD THAT CLIENTS NEED MOST. IN FY 18, THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK PARTNERED WITH 54 GROWERS AND DISTRIBUTED MORE THAN 9 MILLION POUNDS OF FRESH PRODUCE.PANTRY ON THE GO, WHICH OVERCOMES THE CHALLENGE OF NETWORK PARTNERS LACKING SUFFICIENT STORAGE SPACE TO MEET THE NEED IN THEIR COMMUNITY. PANTRY ON THE GO DELIVERS BULK LOADS OF FOOD TO COMMUNITIES THAT LACK CONSISTENT ACCESS TO FOOD, AND IS EXTREMELY EFFECTIVE IN GETTING FRESH FOOD INTO THE HANDS OF NEEDY FAMILIES BEFORE IT PERISHES. IN FY 18, THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK HOSTED 1,278 MOBILE PANTRIES, DISTRIBUTING ABOUT 8.7 MILLION POUNDS OF FOOD TO PREVIOUSLY UNTOUCHED COMMUNITIES.FOODWORKS, OPERATING OUT OF THE CHARLES T. BAUER COMMUNITY KITCHEN, ADDRESSES ONE ROOT CAUSE OF HUNGER: LACK OF JOB TRAINING. FOODWORKS STUDENTS LEARN FOOD SAFETY, NUTRITION AND ADVANCED CULINARY TECHNIQUES WHILE CREATING HEALTHY FROZEN MEALS FROM PERISHABLE PROTEIN AND PRODUCE THAT MIGHT OTHERWISE GO TO WASTE. AS THEY IMPROVE THEIR OWN LIVES, THEY ARE PRESERVING NUTRIENT-RICH FOODS THAT WILL IMPROVE THE LIVES OF COUNTLESS OTHERS ACROSS THE STATE. FOODWORKS GRADUATES ARE WELL-PREPARED FOR SUCCESSFUL CAREERS IN THE FOOD SERVICE INDUSTRY. SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN 2010, FOODWORKS HAS PRODUCED 269 GRADUATES AND NEARLY 1.25 MILLION MEALS FOR MARYLANDERS IN NEED.MFB KIDS INITIATIVE TO END CHILDHOOD HUNGER:THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK'S CHILD HUNGER INITIATIVE IS KNOWN AS MFB KIDS, WHICH INCLUDES THE SCHOOL PANTRY PROGRAM, SUPPER CLUB PROGRAM AND SUMMER CLUB PROGRAM. TOGETHER, THESE PROGRAMS ENSURE A STEADY STREAM OF FOOD REACHES CHILDREN IN NEED YEAR-ROUND.THE SCHOOL PANTRY PROGRAM ESTABLISHES FOOD PANTRIES WITHIN SCHOOLS THAT HAVE HIGH LEVELS OF PARTICIPATION IN THE FREE AND REDUCED PRICE MEAL PROGRAM. FAMILIES IN NEED HAVE CONSISTENT ACCESS TO FOOD THROUGH AN INSTITUTION THAT IS PART OF THEIR EVERYDAY LIVES. SCHOOL PANTRIES ALSO WORK TO ENGAGE PARENTS IN VOLUNTEERISM, HELPING TO STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY AND DE-STIGMATIZE SEEKING FOOD ASSISTANCE. IN FY 18, THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK'S 219 SCHOOL PANTRIES DISTRIBUTED NEARLY 3 MILLION MEALS TO FAMILIES IN NEED. THE SUPPER CLUB PROGRAM SERVES HEALTHY MEALS TO KIDS ENROLLED IN AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMS. INSTEAD OF GOING HOME TO EMPTY CUPBOARDS, KIDS HAVE A HEALTHY DINNER, FOLLOWED BY SPORTS, ARTS AND CRAFTS, HELP WITH HOMEWORK AND MORE. SUPPER CLUBS ARE HELD AT SCHOOLS, BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS, YMCAS, POLICE ATHLETIC LEAGUE CENTERS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. LAST YEAR, APPROXIMATELY 224,529 MEALS WERE CONSUMED AT 52 SITES. THE SUMMER CLUB PROGRAM PROVIDES HEALTHY BREAKFASTS AND LUNCHES TO CHILDREN WHO RELY ON THE FREE AND REDUCED PRICE MEAL PROGRAM DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR, BUT HAVE NOWHERE TO TURN DURING THE SUMMER. LIKE SUPPER CLUBS, SUMMER CLUBS ARE HELD AT SCHOOLS, BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS, YMCAS, POLICE ATHLETIC LEAGUE CENTERS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. IN SUMMER 2018, APPROXIMATELY 150,650 MEALS WERE CONSUMED AT 63 SITES. CSFP - THE COMMODITY SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD PROGRAM, OTHERWISE KNOWN AS "MY GROCERIES TO GO" IS A FEDERAL INITIATIVE, ADMINISTERED BY THE MARYLAND STATE DEPARTMENT OF AGING, THAT PROVIDES VITAL NUTRITION TO LOW-INCOME SENIORS. THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK, THE PROGRAM CHANNELS BOXES OF NUTRITIOUS USDA FOODS INTO ELDERLY COMMUNITIES. MY GROCERIES TO GO IS CRITICAL TO ENSURING THAT MORE THAN 3,000 FOOD-INSECURE SENIORS RECEIVE MONTHLY FOOD ASSISTANCE. THROUGH THE MY GROCERIES TO GO PROGRAM, MFB PARTNERS WITH SENIOR CENTERS AND OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS ACROSS BALTIMORE CITY TO TARGET POPULATIONS OF LOW-INCOME SENIORS WHO MAY BE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE ASSISTANCE.SNAP OUTREACH AIDS LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WHO LACK TRANSPORTATION AND TECHNOLOGY IN APPLYING FOR SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM BENEFITS (SNAP, FORMERLY KNOWN AS FOOD STAMPS). SNAP OUTREACH IS OFTEN PAIRED WITH PANTRY ON THE GO EVENTS, TO PROVIDE IMMEDIATE RELIEF, AND A PLAN FOR FUTURE FOOD SECURITY. THE DSS EMERGENCY FOOD DISTRIBUTION PROGRAM IS A PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK AND THE BALTIMORE CITY DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES TO PROVIDE EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE TO BALTIMORE CITY RESIDENTS IN NEED. WHEN A CITY RESIDENT VISITS A DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES (DSS) FAMILY INVESTMENT CENTER AND REPORTS THAT THEY DO NOT HAVE FOOD, THEY ARE GIVEN AN EMERGENCY FOOD VOUCHER. THESE VOUCHERS CAN BE REDEEMED AT DESIGNATED MFB NETWORK PARTNER SITES, WHICH THEN DISTRIBUTE DSS BOXES, BUILT AT THE FOOD BANK'S BALTIMORE WAREHOUSE, CONTAINING A THREE-DAY SUPPLY OF FOOD. IN FY18, 10,225 BOXES WERE DISTRIBUTED. THE EMERGENCY FEDERAL COMMODITY PROGRAM - ALSO KNOWN AS TEFAP - IS A FEDERAL COMMODITY PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES FOOD FROM THE USDA TO ELIGIBLE CLIENTS. LAST YEAR, MORE THAN 4.5 MILLION POUNDS OF FOOD WAS DISTRIBUTED THROUGH THIS PROGRAM.THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK OPERATES FROM THREE FACILITIES: ONE IN BALTIMORE, ONE IN SALISBURY, AND ONE IN HAGERSTOWN. IN FY 18, THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK DISTRIBUTED ENOUGH FOOD TO PROVIDE MORE THAN 37 MILLION MEALS TO CHILDREN, SENIORS AND FAMILIES IN NEED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAD NO LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE ORGANIZATION'S FEDERAL EXEMPT ORGANIZATION RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE IRS, GENERALLY FOR A PERIOD OF THREE YEARS AFTER THE RETURNS ARE FILED.

THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES THE SERVICES OF BROWN ADVISORY TO PROCESS ALL DONATED STOCKS. BROWN ADVISORY SELLS THE STOCK AND SENDS THE ORGANIZATION THE PROCEEDS. THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES THE SERVICES OF CHARITABLE ADULT RIDES AND SERVICES TO SELL THE DONATED CARS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT SENDS THE AUDIT AND FISCAL OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE THE FORM 990 FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. ONCE APPROVED, MANAGEMENT SENDS THE FORM 990 TO THE ENTIRE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK HAS A WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THAT REQUIRES OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES TO COMPLETE A WRITTEN QUESTIONNAIRE EACH YEAR TO DOCUMENT WHETHER ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST EXIST. FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018 NO CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WERE IDENTIFIED THROUGH THIS PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO WAS DETERMINED BY AN OUTSIDE CONSULTING FIRM IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COMPENSATION FOR OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES WAS DETERMINED BY AN OUTSIDE CONSULTING FIRM IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COPIES OF THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. COPIES OF THE ANNUAL REPORT ARE AVALABLE ON MARYLAND FOOD BANK'S WEBSITE.
